pr_title: new class text.Contains (by analogy with text.EndsWith)

timeline.message: new class text.Contains (by analogy with text.EndsWith)

timeline.bodyText: @iakunin why using some mangled name like this and not just origin and other?
timeline.author: victornoel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,87 @@

+package org.cactoos.text;
+
+import org.cactoos.Scalar;
+import org.cactoos.Text;
+
+/**
+ * Tests if this Text contains other Text.
+ *
+ * @since 1.0
+ */
+public final class Contains implements Scalar<Boolean> {
+
+    /**
+     * The origin.
+     */
+    private final Text origin;
+
+    /**
+     * The other.
+     */
+    private final Text other;
+
+    /**
+     * Ctor .
+     * @param orgn The origin
+     * @param othr The other
+     */
+    public Contains(final String orgn, final String othr) {

replies.bodyText:
@victornoel no problem - can rename if you want =)
It's @yegor256's style. As I remember, this is done to not overlap with corresponding class field names.
replies.author: iakunin

replies.bodyText: @iakunin ok, I'm not really convinced by that, I don't see what it brings except confusion, I don't see the problem with naming overlap since the primary consutructor should only assign parameters to fields... Do you have some source for arguing in favour of this style? I don't remember anything about that.
replies.author: victornoel

replies.bodyText: @victornoel had a quick look at @yegor256's blog and didn't find something about it. Let me just rename this ctor-args and that's it =)
replies.author: iakunin
